main.name: Hunter Danielson
main.description: I am a constant learner, and builder. Two of the thing I enjoy the most about programming is being able to create cool things such as games or visually pleasing pieces, and being able to solve problems.
main.bio: I enjoy learning new technologies and working with ones such as React, Python, and many others. Working on a team or individually is fine with me. In my free time I enjoy playing games with friends, and spending time outside in the elements. I also am an animal lover and have two dogs which I love spending time with.
main.contactmessage: Please don't hesistate to get into contact with me!

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.description: Accredited university where I learned how to code, as well as become a balanced individual and contributer to society. Some courses taken include: assembly language, computer architechture, operating systems, software development, software engineering.

800+ hour intensive MERN-stack (MongoDB, Express, React & Redux, Node) professional training focused on clean code, team-building, individual problem solving, and TDD (Test Driven Development). A 3 part program; a deep dive into vanilla JavaScript, SPA app development and RESTful APIs, and Full-stack React apps with MongoDB + Mongoose.

work.title: Boat Driver
work.description: Worked on a team to provide an exceptional customer experience. During my time customer base grew by 50%.

projects.title: JHEMM-Fighters
projects.category: Game built in vanilla JS utilizing local storage by a team of 5. Players take turns attacking and defending until only one remains!

projects.title: Last Hope
projects.category: Game built in React by a team of 3. It has user authentication and stores data on a backend that we built as well. It also connects to an external colors api.

projects.title: Memory Organizer
projects.category: Backend (Node.js, Express, MongoDB) that provides a space for users to upload photos and notes about their memories. All photos utilize the Google Cloud Vision API to auto-tag the images for increased searchability.

projects.title: Pokedex
projects.category: A pokedex clone, built in React, that utilizes Alchemy Code Labs pokemon API to retrieve data. Has ability to filter results based on the users request.

testimonials.text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
